channel.title: Joe's Truffles
channel.description: An RSS representation of Joe's Truffle feed

item.title: A truffle for 1551798060210
item.description:
Comment: When I look at a new framework or language, I want to start with an easy example to get started. But "hello world" and "Todo MVC" are usually not enough. I'm looking for something more like what this is to fonts: something that shows as much potential as possible in a glance.

Example: The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog.

item.title: A truffle for 1551502207790
item.description:
Comment: Giving this a go for a while.

Radio stream: BBC World Service

item.title: A truffle for 1551057556798
item.description:
Observation: Since getting off social media, I've been taking fewer photos. I have to admit, that does mean I'm telling fewer stories.

Comment: Perhaps I need to commit to taking more photos, regardless of whether I post them or not.

item.title: A truffle for 1550587110929
item.description:
Comment: A good post about how blogs broke the web, ironically published on a blog.

Blog post: https://stackingthebricks.com/how-blogs-broke-the-web/

item.title: A truffle for 1549749232659
item.description: Idea: Instead of doing a chat server, I'm going to do a party server where a game gets displayed on our TV. Stay tuned!

item.title: A truffle for 1549670698687
item.description:
Comment: This keeps coming back to me, I never get around to implementing it though.

Idea: A message system where your ID is the URL where inbound messages live.

Idea parts:

  • Creating a message is simple: POST it to the URL in JSON format
  • Authentication is done through a user ID (URL) and token combination
  • The token is generated on demand and sent back to the URL requesting it
  • Messages can have multiple fields for easy filtering

item.title: A truffle for 1549555672566
item.description: Comment: Been thinking a bit about some of the projects I've wanted to work on (specifically a chat server) and have realized I've spent a lot of time thinking about persistence. What would it look like if I built something with no persistence?

item.title: A truffle for 1548815684623

Framework: SocketCluster

item.title: A truffle for 1548713654598
item.description: Maxim: When you build a plaform where anyone can say pretty much anything, everyone will say everything.

item.title: A truffle for 1545761132517
item.description: Comment: Just learned I've been doing it all wrong: I should be generating an Atom feed instead of RSS!

item.title: A truffle for 1545535209628
item.description:
Comment: Don't know why, but yesterday I had a thought that I should see if there's a way to listen to shortwave radio online. I found one! I can't explain it, but there's something reassuring about being able to hear broadcasts from around the world that are literally shaped by geography itself.

Link: http://websdr.org
